CHS101.name: Elementary Chinese I
CHS101.description: Pronunciation, writing system, and basic vocabulary and sentence patterns, with emphasis on conversation.

CHS102.name: Elementary Chinese II
CHS102.description: Further work on conversation, character writing, and comprehension, with increasing emphasis on vocabulary building and grammar.

CHS201.name: Second-Year Chinese I
CHS201.description: Intermediate-level work on skills in conversation, comprehension, and grammar. Practice in composition.

CHS202.name: Second-Year Chinese II
CHS202.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CHS202.description: Further intermediate-level work on skills in conversation, comprehension, and grammar. Continued practice in composition.

CHS290.name: Independent Study
CHS290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CHS290.description: Special projects in Chinese studies arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

CHS291.name: Special Topics in Chinese
CHS291.description: Special topics in Chinese studies. Topic may vary. Course may be taught in either English or Chinese.

CHS301.name: Third-Year Chinese I
CHS301.description: Advanced-level work on speaking, listening comprehension, reading, and writing skills, based on materials of cultural interest.

CHS302.name: Third-Year Chinese II
CHS302.description: Advanced-level work on speaking, listening comprehension, reading, and writing skills, based on materials of cultural interest.

CHS350.name: Studies in the Chinese Language
CHS350.description: Grammatical structures of modern Chinese, grammar review, sound system, word formation, sentence and discourse structures, dialects and sociolinguistic variation, the history of writing system, pragmatics. Taught in English and Chinese.

CHS360.name: Chinese Film Studies
CHS360.description: Survey of Chinese films focusing on individual expressions with cross-cultural significance. Development of higher-intermediate and advanced language skills. Taught in English and Chinese.

CHS366.name: Chinese Culture: Tradition and Modernity (W)
CHS366.description: Critical concepts necessary to analyze Chinese works from the past three millennia. Key topics include indigenous heritage and modern developments with cross-cultural significance, canonizations of major schools of thought (Confucianism, Daoism, Buddhism), interactions between elite and popular cultures, among others. Taught in English and Chinese.
CHS366.prerequisite: (CHS 202) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

CHS401.name: Fourth-Year Chinese I
CHS401.description: Reading, discussion, and writing of advanced materials, including classical texts of broad cultural interest.

CHS402.name: Fourth-Year Chinese II
CHS402.description: Further reading, discussion and writing based on original materials, including classical texts of broad cultural interest.

CHS410.name: Chinese Short Stories
CHS410.description: Literary and language studies through the genre of short stories in the Chinese language. Taught in Chinese.

CHS411.name: Advanced Spoken Chinese
CHS411.description: Development of advanced speaking skills in Chinese using authentic materials. Presentations, debate, dubbing performance, and interactions with Chinese native speakers.
CHS411.prerequisite: CHS 402 or concurrently or approval of department

CHS466.name: Modern Chinese Literature and Films (W)
CHS466.description: Critical concepts and tools for the analytical study of modern Chinese literature and films on the global stage. Examine major works since the turn of the 20th century. Taught in English and Chinese.
CHS466.prerequisite: ((CHS 366 and CHS 302) or approval of department) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

CHS490.name: Independent Study
CHS490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CHS490.description: Special projects in Chinese studies arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.
CHS490.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors. Approval of department.

CHS491.name: Special Topics in Chinese Studies
CHS491.description: Special topics in Chinese studies. Topics vary.

CHS499.name: Senior Thesis Research
CHS499.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CHS499.description: An individual research project supervised by a faculty member that demonstrates the student's ability to do independent research and submit or present a major paper.

CHS803.name: Foundations of Contemporary Language Teaching
CHS803.description: Theoretical and research foundations for communicative and proficiency-oriented instruction of World languages with implications for the classroom.
